item.title: Edia to port Battle Arena Toshinden games to modern platforms
item.content:encoded:
Battle Arena Toshinden 1, 2, and 3.

Edia has entered into a licensing agreement with Takara Tomy to port 3D fighting games Battle Arena Toshinden, Battle Arena Toshinden 2, and Battle Arena Toshinden 3 to modern platforms, the company announced.

Battle Arena Toshinden first launched for PlayStation on January 9, 1995, followed by Battle Arena Toshinden 2 for arcades on November 24, 1995 and PlayStation on December 29, 1995, and Battle Arena Toshinden 3 for PlayStation on December 27, 1996. All three titles have been released worldwide. The series celebrated its 30th anniversary in January 2025.

The titles will be released between fiscal years 2026 and 2027, leveraging Ediaâ€™s expertise in porting and commercializing retro games to deliver more than simple ports that can be enjoyed by many fans.
